parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Dative Neuter Singular
str2: How much, how great, how many. From an absolute pos and hos; interrogative pronoun how much (plural) many).

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From dia and phero; to bear through, i.e. transport; usually to bear apart, i.e. to toss about; subjectively, to 'differ', or surpass.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
A sheep. Probably neuter of a presumed derivative of probaino; something that walks forward, i.e., a sheep.
So that, therefore, so then, so as to. From hos and te; so too, i.e. Thus therefore.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular

str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
Well, nobly, honorably, rightly. Adverb from kalos; well.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
